result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis W. B. Schemehorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber.

records.addlTxt: File to Clerk to produce electronic JOC.

Defendant Curtis W. B. Schemehorn in court in custody with attorney Kim Roegner.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  GUILTY plea. 
90days JAIL, cc with 14CM1978.  Huber.  53 days credit.  May have furlough from 7-20-15 at noon until 7-22-2015 at noon.  If girlfriend goes into labor before scheduled furlough, she must notify the jail and deft may have up to 48 hours leave. $543 costs due 9-17-15.

Defendant Curtis W. B. Schemehorn in court in custody with attorney Kim Roegner.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
